red_flags.action: Immediate evaluation, chest X-ray, consider hospital admission
Oxygen therapy, urgent chest X-ray, rule out pneumothorax

red_flags.symptom: Signs of meningitis (neck stiffness, altered consciousness)
red_flags.action: Lumbar puncture, start empiric TB meningitis treatment

red_flags.symptom: Severe weight loss (>10% body weight) or BMI < 16
red_flags.action: Nutritional assessment and support, start TB treatment
Immediate ART initiation within 2 weeks of TB treatment start

criteria: Positive sputum culture for M. tuberculosis

treatment_algorithm.title: Confirm Diagnosis
treatment_algorithm.description: Obtain sputum samples and perform GeneXpert or smear microscopy
special_considerations: Collect 2 sputum samples: spot and early morning
If unable to produce sputum, consider induced sputum or gastric aspirate (children)
Start treatment empirically if strong clinical suspicion and cannot wait

treatment_algorithm.title: Intensive Phase (2 months)
treatment_algorithm.description: Daily directly observed therapy (DOT) with 4 drugs
treatment_algorithm.follow_up: Monthly sputum, liver function tests at baseline and 1 month
special_considerations: DOT mandatory - observe patient swallowing medications
Take medications on empty stomach (1 hour before food)
Monitor for hepatotoxicity (jaundice, nausea, abdominal pain)

treatment_algorithm.title: Continuation Phase (4 months)
treatment_algorithm.description: Daily therapy with 2 drugs after negative sputum at 2 months
treatment_algorithm.follow_up: Monthly clinic visits, sputum at end of treatment
special_considerations: Total treatment duration: 6 months for new pulmonary TB
Extend to 8-12 months for TB meningitis, bone/joint TB
Patient can stop DOT if adherent and tolerating well

treatment_algorithm.title: MDR-TB Treatment (if rifampicin resistant)
treatment_algorithm.description: Longer treatment with second-line drugs - REFER TO SPECIALIST
special_considerations: Social support critical for long treatment
Monitor for drug interactions with ARVs

distinguishing_features: Chronic productive cough with purulent sputum

complications.name: Drug-induced hepatitis
complications.prevention: Baseline and monthly liver function tests
complications.management: Stop all TB drugs if ALT > 5x normal or jaundice; reintroduce sequentially

complications.name: TB-IRIS (Immune Reconstitution Inflammatory Syndrome)
risk_factors: Starting ART soon after TB treatment
complications.prevention: Delay ART 2-8 weeks after TB treatment start
complications.management: Continue TB/ART, add prednisone 1 mg/kg for severe cases

complications.name: Hemoptysis
complications.prevention: Adequate TB treatment to heal cavities
complications.management: Bed rest, antifibrinolytics, bronchoscopy/surgery if massive

prevention.effectiveness: Prevents severe TB (meningitis, miliary) in children by 70-80%, limited effect on pulmonary TB

prevention.target_population: Household contacts of TB patients, especially children < 5 and HIV+
prevention.effectiveness: Isoniazid 6 months reduces TB risk by 60%, 3HP (isoniazid + rifapentine 3 months) by 90%

prevention.target_population: All household and close contacts of TB patients
prevention.effectiveness: Identifies 5-10% of contacts with active TB
Natural ventilation, UV lights, N95 masks reduce nosocomial transmission
